meanings.definition: The act of applying too much of something.
meanings.sent1: Her overapplications of makeup made her face look unnatural.
meanings.sent2: The overapplications of paint on the wall caused it to crack.
meanings.sent3: His overapplications of cologne made everyone around him sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The overapplications of icing on the cake made it too sweet to eat.
meanings.sent5: The overapplications of fertilizer in the garden resulted in burnt plants.

meanings.definition: Excessive use or application of something.
meanings.sent1: The overapplications of technology in the classroom distracted the students.
meanings.sent2: The overapplications of force in the situation only made things worse.
meanings.sent3: The overapplications of perfume in the elevator made it smell like a flower shop.
meanings.sent4: The overapplications of rules in the game made it less enjoyable for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The overapplications of pressure on the machine caused it to malfunction.
